title: Emotion-Based Instructional Design Strategies: Enhancing Pre-Service and In-Service Teacher Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design knowledge and social studies teaching experience
context.additional_context: Corporate teacher retraining program providing short modular learning units utilizing mobile environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify five core emotions (fear, jealousy, anger, empathy, joy) occurring in educational settings.
Learners can apply 20 strategies to mitigate negative emotions (fear, jealousy, anger) and promote positive emotions (empathy, joy) in actual lesson designs.
Learners can develop a social studies lesson plan (3 microlearning modules) incorporating emotion design elements through project-based assessment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
